did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: UHCL Bay Area Houston Economic Partnership Records

extref.corpname: University of Houston-Clear Lake Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: The Nassau Bay Garden Club collection documents the organizational records of the Nassau Bay Garden Club from 1964-2000.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The partnership was originally incorporated in May 1976 as the Clear Lake Area Economic Development Foundation (CLAEDF) by a core group of merchants and corporation executives to promote business, tourism, and the continued development of the Space Program in the Clear Lake area. In 1995, the name changed to Bay Area Houston Economic Partnership (BAHEP), to signify the wider expanse of influence and development which was no longer limited to the Clear Lake Area, and included many of the communities along the Gulf Coast around Houston.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 15 boxes of materials pertaining to the development of the Bay Area Houston Economic Partnership (BAHEP), formerly known as the Clear Lake Area Economic Development Foundation (CLAEDF), from its beginning in 1976 to 2009. CLAEDF and BAHEP operated as promotional marketing and development agencies for businesses in the Bay Area and its communities. The collection includes organizational histories, minutes, newspaper articles, press releases, promotional brochures, events, awards, photographs and magazines. It should be noted that the Executive Committee minutes and handouts from 1991-1996 were donated by Joe D. Barlow from his personal papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into 11 series:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: UHCL Bay Area Houston Economic Partnership (BAHEP) Records, #2010-0001, University of Houston-Clear Lake Archives

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Kathryn Black Morrow and Jean Grant, undated.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated by the Bay Area Houston Economic Partnership (BAHEP) in 2009.
